2023-12-29T08:03:25Z

🇯🇵 📚 Naruto volume 7 ✅

⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐

Very decent volume. Good amount of fighting, and we’ve got insights into many characters from the village and some of the mysterious ones like Gaara and Kabuto.

Things start to get complicated. Why would Orochimary infect Sasuke with that? What’s the plan behind it? Will the author expand on this soon or are we continuing the exam as if nothing happened?

➡️ https://manga.ricard.blog/reviews/naruto/volume/7/

#Naruto #NarutoManga #Manga

The series finale was truly awful 💩

There was no fight and barely an explanation of what was going on.

It seems we did a time jump there at the end? No good cliffhanger either. It's not like I would be dying to watch the next one if it was available.

I had such high expectations for the finale. I haven't started the manga yet, is this how the manga goes? I will find out...

What did you think of the finale?

2023-12-27T18:27:12Z

⭐ ⭐

Such a mediocre ending.

I expected so much more from the series. It's a good thing it has an open-ended finale but these 3 last chapters have been garbage.

In the end, the father does not have cancer but hemorrhoids (fun!), everything returns to normal and no one has died 🤷

Akira has a very good heart and he forgives everyone. I don't know...

Would I recommend the series? Well, the first 6-8, no doubt. The rest? Meh.

2023-12-27T17:51:40Z

⭐ ⭐

I'm not sure if this episode deserves 1 star, it was so bad.

I don't know what the author's intention was, honestly. Should we feel sorry for these people who, because they are miserable, want to kill innocent people?

They are scum. If they are so unhappy on this planet, jump off a bridge or ask for help. But to harm innocent people for fun?

I am very disappointed with this series. It started great and went downhill.

⭐ ⭐ ⭐

I want to read more!

2023-12-21T12:47:41Z

⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐

🇯🇵 📚 Ao Ashi Volume 10 ✅

We’ve got a nice volume right here. Packed with action, almost no talking, the way I like it!

We haven’t seen any major character development just struggle. At this point, I can’t tell what’s going to happen with this match. Could go either way.

I’m more interested in seeing how Ashito will grow in this role of playmaker.

Will he realize soon that is his destiny?

➡️ https://manga.ricard.blog/reviews/ao-ashi/volume/10/

#AoAshiManga #AoAshi #Manga

2023-12-20T21:30:25Z

⭐⭐⭐

🇯🇵 📚 My Hero Academia volume 4 ✅

I’m looking forward to moving past this school event and going back to heroes fighting villains. We’ve got a glimpse in volume 2 of how cool the fights can be when they invaded the school. I want more of that.

I will certainly keep collecting the manga.

➡️ https://manga.ricard.blog/reviews/my-hero-academia/volume/4/

#BokuNoHero #MyHeroAcademiaManga #MyHeroAcademia #Manga

🆕 🎙️ Frontend Coffee Break

Episode 23: Impostor Syndrome in Frontend

What is the Impostor Syndrome? How to fight it? Why is it more common than we think in Frontend development? We discuss this and offer some tips that have worked for us!

🎧 https://frontendcoffeebreak.transistor.fm/s1/23

:youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=heULnivsm64

#Podcast #FECoffeeBreak #Frontend

2023-12-11T15:28:54Z

:javascript: It has been a while since quickly bootstrapped a #Vue project, pleasantly surprised with the provided quick start 🏎️

One NPM line gets you set up with the Vue app, unit testing, E2E testing, linting, prettier... :blobcataww:

It's fantastic to see the state of the frontend tooling in 2023 😎 So easy!

➡️ https://vuejs.org/guide/quick-start.html

#Vue #JavaScript #Frontend #WebDevelopment

Maybe I hate too high hopes for the story? I expect too much? What do I even expect?

🆕 Manga review: Midori no Hibi - Volume 1

⭐ ⭐ ⭐

Got the nine volumes for this series from a friend for cheap, so I gave it a try. I think did watch the anime many years ago but never read the manga, nor had any interest.

Don’t get me wrong, volume one was easy to read and fun but not something I’d invest money in having so many other good series in my to-purchase list.

➡️ https://manga.ricard.blog/reviews/midori-no-hibi/volume/1/

#MidoriNoHibiManga #Manga #MidoriNoHibi

A little disappointed with this episode. It started great, cool fight on both fronts. Then the flashback was cheaply drawn, in my opinion (was the manga drawn this way? no mouth? simple comical style?).

How will Itadori get out of this one?

2023-11-29T07:43:30Z

In Spain there isn't Black Friday sales for books 📚 :blobcat_sadlife:

💰 The book prices are regulated nation-wide and no discounts can be applied other than the maximum 5% (with the exception of an additional +5% on April 23rd) 🌹 📖

Regardless... I bought some #manga 🇯🇵 as I have finished the volumes I had sitting unread 😂

Will share a photo when delivered :ablobcatbongo:

Wind Breaker volume 1 by Satoru Nii is read ✅

I have mixed feelings. I like the drawing style, and the pace, so far the main character is very shonen, it has most of the ingredients to make it interesting.

At the end of the day I’m here for the fights, so I hope they don’t dwell too much on being the neighborhood pacifists and start fist-fighting.

I will buy the next volume 💸

I’ve binge-watched this anime in two days and enjoyed it quite a bit. It paints sweet romance stories that we all wished we had back in high school.

2023-11-01T10:58:22Z

This time of the year in Catalonia it's tradition to eat (or should you have the skills, bake) "panellets" a sweet made mostly of almond and sugar with many variants.

I love the ones with pine nuts or lemon 🤩

These are homemade, my mum is the best (they made like 3kg worth 😂 )

📸 https://ricard.photos/%f0%9f%a4%a4-3/

⭐⭐⭐

🇯🇵 📚 Servamp volume 1 ✅

I like volumes with fat chapters like these, five chapters in one volume. Love it. Lots of content and fewer cliffhangers.

I think this volume was okay, maybe I would liked a little bit more action. They got us hooked in the first and second chapters, but that was it 🥲

What do I look forward to in volume 2?

(yes, I’ve already purchased the second volume 💸)

More action 😁

⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐

🇯🇵 📚 Naruto volume 6, done! ✅

This volume was very good, it was all action, no talking, I loved it.

We got to see new characters, Orochimaru the villain for this arc I suppose, and just good ninja stuff. The character development was also interesting, perhaps Sakura did the most growing.

Onto the next!

"How Google Alters Search Queries to Get at Your Wallet"

"Say you search for “children’s clothing.” Google converts it, without your knowledge, to a search for “NIKOLAI-brand kidswear,” making a behind-the-scenes substitution of your actual query with a different query that just happens to generate more money for the company"

EDIT: WIRED in an update, has decided to remove the article 😮

➡️ https://www.wired.com/story/google-antitrust-lawsuit-search-results/

🆕 How to overwrite HTML with #Cypress

Here's a quick snippet to allow you change the HTML of a page before Cypress fires your tests.

It took me a little to find the solution, as the docs are not super clear. So I wrote this:

➡️ https://ricard.dev/how-to-overwrite-html-with-cypress/

2023-09-08T10:34:20Z

@bashlk Indeed!

I'm a big fan of JSDoc and can't see the benefit of using full TS in its place. Whenever something more complex is needed in JSDoc I create a simple interface. It's all comments, all valid JS.

⭐⭐⭐

📚 #AoAshi #manga volume 7 is done! ✅

It felt a little bit worse maybe because of the overall mood. We see Ashito struggling, people yelling at him, telling him to go home even 🤬

He’s being portrayed as knowing nothing (which could be somewhat true at being a defender) but is it too much? He’s brilliant at times (without realizing it, that’s fine!) but other times is like… “Oh right, I could watch videos and learn from them” 🤦‍♂️

➡️ https://manga.ricard.blog/reviews/ao-ashi/chapter/72/

Answer is TRUE and this thing is browser supported since ancient times.

I just learned about this today from a colleague.

When would I need this? Uncertain.

2023-08-11T10:40:13Z

In #JavaScript :javascript: what would this return?

"0 < Number.MIN_VALUE"

After voting, you may check the docs 😉

➡️ https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number/MIN_VALUE

2023-08-11T07:17:19Z

@elwinvaneede On point, Elwin.

I found it funny that the article was a little like "look at this new CSS feature that's more performant than JS" 😁

🆕 Frontend Coffee Break 🎧

Episode 19: Should you be constantly challenged?

What benefits frontend developers the most: working on long-term projects, or switching every six months? 🤝

Chucho and I discuss the FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out) on new technologies in the changing world of frontend development.

➡️ https://frontendcoffeebreak.transistor.fm/s1/19

#podcast #Frontend #webDevelopment

2023-08-10T21:36:52Z

⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐

End of #AoAshi #manga volume 4! ✅

This volume has been very good overall, I think the best so far in terms of drawing.

Such intense panels, it has kept me reading fast. I read the whole volume in one sitting. I usually never do this, as I want to pace myself and enjoy them more. Was hard to stop reading this one. Well done.

➡️ https://manga.ricard.blog/reviews/ao-ashi/chapter/39/

#AoAshiManga

2023-08-10T21:32:05Z

@gpage Now, I have even removed all the relays (which has lowered the CPU usage and storage considerably) in favor of https://github.com/g3rv4/GetMoarFediverse

If I started from scratch I would look at the alternatives, no doubt, before committing to a backend.

2023-08-10T21:31:56Z

@gpage Hey Grayson, I stayed with Mastodon because moving the backend to Pleroma or Akkoma seemed very complicated while keeping the same domain. I could not encounter anyone that did it successfully.

I did not want to change the domain (or subdomain) or lose my followers.

After the disk usage issue was resolved, the Mastodon instance got very stable.

2023-08-10T20:23:22Z

@scott So grateful for all the goodies in #CSS we've received this the past year.

Awesome push from all the browser vendors.

2023-08-10T20:13:24Z

Are there even cases when a #CSS implementations of a #JavaScript :javascript: behavior performs worse than JS?

"A case study on scroll-driven animations performance"

➡️ https://developer.chrome.com/blog/scroll-animation-performance-case-study/

#Frontend #WebPerformance #WebDevelopment

2023-08-10T20:11:06Z

@shanselman Bummer, I would imagine you're entitled to some compensation after landing. In the EU for long hauls, it's at least around 600€, better get informed.

Happened to me a few years back when flying from London to Seoul. I reached them out via social media and British Airways wired me the compensation in a matter of days. Great service.

This is very nice! Look at this optional chaining proposal :javascript:

obj?.prop = value;

Which would be equivalent to:

if (obj) obj.prop = value;

I need this :blobcataww:

2023-06-16T21:19:18Z

What options do I have on #Android to have the advanced multi-column #Mastodon layout? As I do on desktop web?

- #Tusky has a max number of columns. It's good but I want more columns.
- The official Mastodon app for Android doesn't even have custom columns 🤦‍♂️
- The mobile view of the PWA doesn't show custom columns either :blobcat_sadlife:

The only ugly workaround is to use "Desktop View" while on the PWA to get the desktop advanced view and pinch to zoom :blobcatnotlikethis:

#Frontend #CSS :css3:

2023-03-30T05:57:49Z

@jeena If it's the first time, and also depending on where you have your images could take hours.

If you still have images in the same disk as Mastodon is way faster. Deleting from S3 Object Storage is usually very slow. The whole cron task takes for me around 15 minutes.

Thank you for sharing and the mention, Jeena!

2023-03-24T14:58:48Z

@ab Sure, added! ✅

2023-03-24T11:18:08Z

@mondanzo It's different. The cache retention deletes everything (posts you've liked, bookmarked, etc).

There's a PR to amend the text so it's easier to understand.

The CLI commands are way more refined and only delete stuff you haven't interacted with, etc.

2023-03-24T08:19:27Z

@mondanzo Does this help?

➡️ https://ricard.dev/improving-mastodons-disk-usage/

2023-03-24T07:51:25Z

@julian :blobcatfingerguns:

2023-03-24T07:50:41Z

@julian The downside (hence why I didn't do it) is that it can't be automated. I didn't want to have to request and export, download and import it to the other system manually.

Using the Mastodon API and GitHub Actions running every day, I know my archive is fresh every morning.

2023-03-24T07:49:38Z

@julian You could totally skip the API. Just go to your Mastodon instance profile settings and request an export of your posts.

Then have Hugo or something else read that export and build a site with it.

2023-03-16T07:54:59Z

@patrick I recently moved to another cloud provider.

Wasn't too hard to setup Mastodon again

Long story short, just install it and import the DB backup.

If you are using Object Storage the media assets are a non-issue. Otherwise maybe rsync to bring them to the other machine?

https://ricard.dev/moving-from-linode-to-netcup/

2023-03-16T07:52:19Z

@ayo From my research it's very lightweight, night and day compared to Mastodon when it comes to hardware requirements.

But moving an existing account to another BE on the same domain... I couldn't find a success story anywhere.

2023-03-15T09:49:14Z

Trying out the new Bing chat which now uses GPT-4 :blobcatglare:

I've sent it a pure :javascript: function and asked it to provide unit tests for it :blobcateyes:

It did. I've pasted them into my project without any change and all green ✅

I don't think it will take our jobs but it will speed things up and save us from slow tasks. We developers should focus on a bigger picture :blobcatthinking:

Your thoughts❓

➡️ https://blogs.bing.com/search/march_2023/Confirmed-the-new-Bing-runs-on-OpenAI%E2%80%99s-GPT-4

🏦 Banks... 😒

1. I've tried to do two different purchases with my credit card (to two different stores) and the purchases got denied ❌

2. Contacted my bank and they said there's a problem with the store not my card :blobfoxthinkanime:

3. Used a friend's card from the same bank to buy on the same store. Success ✅

4. The bank says they'll send me a new credit card :blobcatnotlikethis:

It's easier for them to issue a new card than try to find what's wrong with my current one 🤦‍♂️

postgresql@15-main.service: A process of this unit has been killed by the OOM killer.

2023-02-27T07:19:43Z

@armin@afop.tech @lifeofguenter Disk space is not an issue, plenty available. All my cache is on an S3 Object Storage

Thanks to@uastronomer@mastodon.monoceros.co.za I just found this in the syslog :blobcateyes:

systemd[1]: postgresql@15-main.service: A process of this unit has been killed by the OOM killer.

systemd[1]: system-postgresql.slice: A process of this unit has been killed by the OOM killer.

2023-02-26T10:54:58Z

@rolle @vito I think not. Mastodon will not know the files are gone, it will try to serve them and the S3 will return 404 until the sync is done.

The reason I turned it on before the sync was to have already the new files uploaded to the S3. Didn't want to have to do yet another sync after the first one.

Not sure if this make sense.

2023-02-26T10:51:03Z

@rolle @vito I did the S3 switch while doing the sync. Being in a single-user instance that's not an issue, plus all the browser caching (or CDN if you have that already)

2023-02-16T19:59:23Z

@rolle 1TB of assets? That's inmense for a 4 user instance 😮 I'm currently at 25Gb and have like 10-12 relays.

What does your cronjob to delete assets look like?

Here's mine: https://ricard.dev/improving-mastodons-disk-usage/

The only reason to change to an S3 would be reduce the storage cost. Not sure what's your deal with Hetzner but usually dedicated S3 object storage is just cheaper than regular SSD's.

2023-02-16T19:53:07Z

@Robworks@phpc.social Thanks!

dynamic name attribute would be nice, markup is there on page load rather than waiting for JS. But you don't look very convinced 😁

2023-02-16T19:51:15Z

@pixelcode I see it now 🙃 ✅

2023-02-16T19:50:36Z

@rolle The server does not have to be offline, as mentioned you can point it to S3 so it starts uploading there while you sync

2023-02-16T19:48:06Z

@rolle Yes, that should do it.

Since you're in, what seems to be, a single user instance you could do the following:

1. Change the Mastodon config to point to the S3 (yes, it would break the existing downloaded images but if it's just you using the instance, it's not a big issue. Byt doing this the newly found image would start to be uploaded directly to S3)

2. Start the sync using the CLI so the already downloaded go to the S3.

3. Done? 😁

2023-02-16T19:16:20Z

@rolle thank you for the feedback!

I don't fully know how that storage mount works but you should be able to use a CLI to sync it to an S3. I've used AWS CLI and had no problems moving from local to S3 and the other way around.

2023-02-12T22:43:12Z

@stormy178@mastodon.stormy178.com If the FE seems not to be correctly compiled try this one, should delete webpack's output:

RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails assets:clobber

Then the well known to build the FE again:

RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails assets:precompile

2023-02-10T15:10:18Z

@afiestas @garritfra Well I think you don't usually put a CDN in front of cold storage data (glacier). It's meant to almost never be accessed. I'm not sure if you can even add a CDN in front.

For regular data you do standard S3 storage.

#Scaleway

2023-02-06T15:50:44Z

😮 Learning about cold storage (S3 Glacier compatible Object Storage).

This particular provider states:

"Stored in a former nuclear fallout shelter 25 meters underground, your data is totally secure and isolated from all natural and technological risks."

💡 Thinking about using it for storing my processed photos (around 600Gb) which should cost me about 1.5€ / month. I do need assurance against nuclear war :blobfoxthinkanime:

#Scaleway

2023-02-05T10:05:52Z

@Lapineige Thanks for clarifying!

2023-02-05T10:01:43Z

@ayo Agreed! I'm looking forward the next 4.1.0 release where we'll be able to remove avatars and/or headers from remote accounts. Which wasn't possible until just now.

Truth be told I used to just delete the headers folder manually once every few weeks to free up my S3 storage. I couldn't care less for profile headers.

2023-02-05T09:56:00Z

@ayo Yeah, not with Mastodon. I think #Akkoma and #Pleroma work like that, they don't download remote assets.

But it's not a great architecture either, because all instances act as CDN for you.

Granted it takes a lot of space on your instance but if a remove instance goes down, is not available or just slow you don't notice it.

2023-02-05T08:29:08Z

@ayo @elias What a coincidence 😆 I'm moving Object Storage provider today and it's being a challenge so far.

I've managed to download 50Gb of assets from old S3 provider and now I'm trying to upload to the new provider. But the default upload set it to "private" which is no good. Trying to find a flag/command with the aws CLI to recursively upload while setting public policy.

Tough stuff!

EDIT: I think I've found it

"--recursive --acl public-read"

@simevidas As usual I think it depends on the type of website. Most marketing websites that are presentation, sure 💜 The less JavaScript the better.

2023-01-18T21:03:25Z

@overminddl1 I think the reason was particularly because #Pleroma does not download assets to the server. Meaning the other instances act as a CDN for pleroma servers. This model is unsustainable for large instances.

When you use Mastodon, you get all the assets downloaded and served from your instance.

2023-01-11T14:53:10Z

@charlesroper I like Cypress for simple stuff, it can get complex fast if you need to mock API's and stuff.

The syntax in the end it's JavaScript unfortunately, should you be looking for no-code.

It has a built-in test recorder (records clicks, keyboard strokes and such) so you can create tests easily. For less advanced users that don't want to write the tests manually.

2022-12-26T17:44:52Z

2022-12-26T17:43:44Z

@kabir There's a command merged to the stable (not yet released) that will delete old avatars and headers. Which are currently not deleted by any out of the box command.

If you don't care about headers (I don't) some ideas we've had:

- Replace all images by a 1x1 pixel file
- Just delete the headers folder (that's why I currently do)

➡️ https://ricard.dev/improving-mastodons-disk-usage/

2022-12-21T09:28:54Z

@pasmac What do you mean?

Some single-user instance admins say you don't even need a CDN, that they pull directly form the S3 bucket.

Since it's actually free for my usage, I decided to use AWS CloudFront in front of the S3 bucket, to reduce even more the usage in the bucket.

Not sure if I made any sense 😁

2022-12-08T08:57:07Z

@Robb Love it!

2022-12-07T22:46:46Z

@matt @nobodyknows that's how #Pleroma does it. They don't store remote assets.

On one side big instances would suffer as being CDN for all smaller instances. The same way, a smaller instance with popular accounts would suffer.

It could also be if those servers were slow serving you or your users would have a degraded experience. That's one of the reasons, I think, Mastodon chose the architecture of storing everything locally.

Just guessing.

2022-12-07T22:37:30Z

@matt @nobodyknows true, you might not even need CDN

2022-12-07T22:28:39Z

@matt @nobodyknows that's exactly what I did. So far so good.

#BackBlaze seems to be one of the best and cheapest options. Go for it.

Don't forget a CDN. I used AWS CloudFront with their ridiculous high free tier.

2022-12-01T09:23:38Z

@garritfra CloudFront from #AWS has an absurd high monthly free tier

- 1 TB of data transfer out
- 10,000,000 HTTP or HTTPS Requests
- 2,000,000 CloudFront Function Invocations

https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/pricing/

I didn't but if you don't mind moving your domain DNS to Cloudflare, they also offer free CDN egress cost with B2 https://www.backblaze.com/b2/solutions/content-delivery.html

@YoSiJo Hey, thanks 💜

Just an hour ago I realized I had IPv6 DNS record for the domain and no NGINX for port 80

I've updated the DNS record to remove it. So it looks exactly like all my other domains.

On the other hand, should I keep the IPv6 record I'm not sure how would I'd fix the wrong cert for serving from NGINX.

2022-11-27T16:12:03Z

@wild1145 I think it could have been something with IPv6

I've compared my other domains and .dev had it set up at the Linode Domain dashboard, for some reason.

I've removed the extra configuration (which I don't remember creating) for IPv6 and now they look the same, see if that solves it after propagation 🤞

Thank you again for the feedback 💜

2022-11-27T15:55:49Z

@wild1145 Yep. Tried myself on FF and Safari and I do see the new cert.

2022-11-27T15:54:05Z

@wild1145 This is very weird. The nginx site config for .dev and .social is pointing to a different cert 🤷

2022-11-27T15:53:02Z

@wild1145 I have re-issues a certificate for the .dev domain.

Could you please try again? 🙏

2022-11-27T15:39:42Z

@wild1145 Thank you for the heads up

Something weird is going on as I can load it no problem :blobcatthinking:

2022-11-27T15:38:44Z

@stibbons@social.yeoldenerds.online Absolutely true, Pleroma has less user base and not as active development.

2022-11-27T15:22:59Z

@stibbons@social.yeoldenerds.online One big problem is that avatars/headers are not purged with any of the out of the box commands.

I've written some ideas here: https://ricard.dev/improving-mastodons-disk-usage/

2022-11-17T19:15:24Z

@digiphile @mathewi Good piece!

I think it's too dangerous for the journalist to huddle in the same instance. They are looking for some sort of "verification" by being in that instance, but that's just too easy to block.

Why not spread around and use the built-in verification system?

2022-11-11T14:18:59Z

@jeremyckahn I've been running my single-user instance for a couple it weeks. Storage is everything, not so much CPU or RAM. It fills up fast.

So for multiple users I would expect you have to add extra "object storage". AWS S3 usually being the cheapest, we're talking $1 for several dozen GBs, it's not so bad. VPS providers also have these.

I would not recommend having the instance open for all without a Patreon model or similar.

2022-11-11T14:00:00Z

@jeremyckahn depends on the user size. Single-user instance probably runs fine in a 5$ Linode

2022-11-11T13:19:02Z

@danyork So true, Dan

That's also why we need more smaller instances rather than centralize everyone on mastodon dot social

This way it's just easy to block unwanted people or federate with instances you're happy with 💜

2022-11-11T10:30:19Z

@verbeeld You should definitely host your own! 💜

The #devOps part is not trivial as it needs proper setup (beyond the official installation docs) otherwise it fills the disk very rapidly (thus increasing the hosting costs).

It is nonetheless fun 😃

2022-11-10T12:05:35Z

@nolan The worst part so far is disk space for cache on remote media, avatars and headers.

Avatars and headers seem to never get purged, it just keeps on filling up 🙄

I ended up doing a bash script to replace all header files with a 1x1 pixel to save space. As I don't really care for user headers.

2022-11-08T19:58:45Z

@jbinto Nice!

- Hashtags work fine on my instance, I can search for them and pin them in columns.
- You can add "relays" to populate your federated timeline. The best way, however is to start following people (see who they follow and go down the rabbit hole)
- You can easily mute or suspend instances from interacting with your from the Admin dashboard
